intro: Maranthes gabunensis, commonly known as the Gabon maranthes, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Zingiberaceae, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with yellow and white petals. It is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Its botanical characteristics make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
